DS3 Manual
DS3: A System-Level Domain-Specific System-on-ChipSimulationFramework
config_file_first_example.ini
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 # This file contains all the file names and variables to initialize the DASH_SIM
2 
3 [DEFAULT]
4 # Configuration file that contains available resources in DASH-SoC
5 resource_file = SoC.Top.txt
6 
7 # Configuration files for applications
8 # To feed multiple applications, please separate the file names with a comma
9 # (do not include a space between file names) and be sure that resource file
10 # has all information about the tasks from all task graphs
11 job_file = job_Top.txt
12 
13 ### Workload Generation ###
14 # You have two option to generate a workload
15 # 1-) Provide probabilities for appliactions defined in job_file
16 # In this case, jobs will be created based on the probabilities
17 # For example, assume a workload is based on two applications and probabilities are [0.5,0.5]
18 # Then, total number of jobs generated will be equally divided between two applications
19 # 2-) Generate a specific workload by manually creating snippets composed of predetermined number of jobs
20 
21 # Probability of each app for being selected as the new job
22 job_probabilities = [1]
23 
24 # Define a list (snippet) with the number of jobs to be executed per application
25 # <WiFi TX, WiFi RX, Range, SCT, SCR>
26 # This configuration is expected to match the order of the MERGE_LIST variable in the common.py file.
27 # Use [] to disable this config
28 # For multiple snippets, define a list of lists
29 job_list = []
30 
31 # If job_list is enabled, a fixed number of jobs will be injected. inject_fixed_num_jobs, max_jobs, and simulation_length are not used as the total number of jobs is automatically obtained from the job_list.
32 # Executes a pre-defined number of jobs
33 inject_fixed_num_jobs = yes
34 # If inject_fixed_num_jobs is enabled, define the total number of jobs that will be generated during the simulation
35 max_jobs = 1
36 # If inject_fixed_num_jobs is disabled, define the length of the simulation (in us)
37 simulation_length = 100000
38 
39 # The core simulation engine tick with simulation clock (in us)
40 clock = 1
41 
42 # The scheduler name
43 scheduler = ETF
44 
45 # Injects a new job as soon as the previous job finished its execution
46 inject_jobs_asap = no
47 
48 # Sets a fixed injection rate (this is overwritten by the inject_jobs_asap config)
49 fixed_injection_rate = no
50 
51 # Defines maximum number of jobs in the system at any point in time during simulation
52 max_jobs_in_parallel = 12
53 
54 # The variable to control the random state for the job inter-arrival time
55 random_seed = 1
56 
57 # Standard deviation for randomization of execution time
58 # as a percentage (0 => 1 of expected execution time)
59 standard_deviation = 0.0
60 
61 [TRACE]
62 # Assign trace variables to be yes (or no) to save traces of the execution
63 clean_traces = yes
64 trace_tasks = no
65 trace_system = no
66 trace_frequency = no
67 trace_PEs = no
68 trace_IL_predictions = no
69 trace_temperature = no
70 trace_load = no
71 create_dataset_DTPM = no
72 
73 # Trace file names
74 trace_file_tasks = trace_tasks.csv
75 trace_file_system = trace_system.csv
76 trace_file_frequency = trace_frequency.csv
77 trace_file_PEs = trace_PEs.csv
78 trace_file_temperature = trace_temperature.csv
79 trace_file_temperature_workload = trace_temperature_workload.csv
80 trace_file_load = trace_load.csv
81 results = results.csv
82 
83 [POWER MANAGEMENT]
84 # Sampling rate for the DVFS mechanism
85 sampling_rate = 10
86 sampling_rate_temperature = 20
87 
88 # High and low thresholds for the ondemand mode
89 util_high_threshold = 0.8
90 util_low_threshold = 0.3
91 
92 # Thermal trip points configuration
93 enable_throttling = no
94 trip_temperature = [85, 90, 95]
95 trip_hysteresis = [3, 3, 3]
96 enable_DTPM_throttling = no
97 DTPM_trip_temperature = [95, 100, 105]
98 
99 # Coefficients for the leakage power model (Odroid XU3 board)
100 C1 = 0.002488
101 C2 = 2660
102 Igate = 0.000519
103 T_ambient = 42
104 
105 [SIMULATION MODE]
106 # Choose the simulation mode, i.e., validation or performance
107 # In validation mode simulation runs until it finishes the total number of jobs
108 # In performance mode simulation runs until it reaches the simulation length
109 simulation_mode = validation
110 
111 #### if validation is chosen, define the variables below
112 # The variable used to adjust the mean value of the job inter-arrival time
113 # scale variable equals to inverse of lambda in exponential distribution (scale = 1/lambda)
114 scale = 100
115 
116 #### if performance is chosen, define the variables below
117 # warmup is the time period till which no result will be recorded
118 warmup_period = 0
119 
120 # number of iteration to run for a given scale value (1/lambda)
121 num_of_iterations = 3
122 
123 # list of scale values which will determine the job arrival rate under performance mode
124 # construct the list based on range() function in python
125 # start-stop-step
126 scale_values = 500-501-1
127 
128 [COMMUNICATION MODE]
129 # The packet size (in bits)
130 packet_size = 256
131 
132 # Note: choose either Pe_to_PE or shared_memory
133 # To use PE to PE communication, assign yes to the variable
134 PE_to_PE = yes
135 
136 # To use a shared memory for the communication, assign yes to the variable
137 shared_memory = no
138 
139 [DEBUG]
140 # Assign debug variables to be yes (or no) to check the flow of the simulation
141 debug_config = no
142 debug_sim = no
143 debug_job = no
144 debug_sch = no
145 
146 [INFO]
147 # Assign info variables to be yes (or no) get the information about the flow of the simulation
148 info_sim = no
149 info_job = yes
150 info_sch = no
